conclusion: The metal rod ab is suspended horizontally by two identical springs with spring constant k, in a uniform magnetic field B perpendicular to the paper.
The rod has a length L, uniform density, and thickness.
When a current I1 passes through the rod, the springs do not stretch.
The magnetic force F_mag1 balances the weight of the rod mg.
F_mag1 = B I1 L and B I1 L = mg.
The current direction is from b to a and the magnitude of the current is I2 where I2 > I1.
The magnetic force F_mag2 = B I2 L is greater than the weight of the rod mg.
The net force on the rod must be zero for it to be in equilibrium.
The springs will stretch to balance the forces.
mg = B I1 L from the first scenario.
F_net = B I2 L - mg and F_net = B L (I2 - I1).
Equating the net force to the spring force: B L (I2 - I1) = 2kx.
Solving for x: x = (B L (I2 - I1)) / (2k).
